ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Force IOMMU usage in GRUB2
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Look for argument iommu=force in the kernel line in /etc/default/grub.

ns0:criterion.comment: check for iommu=force in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT
check for iommu=force in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Confirm Existence and Permissions of System Log Files
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All syslog log files should be owned by the appropriate group.

ns0:extend_definition.comment: rsyslog daemon is used as local logging daemon

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if all system log files are owned by root group

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Confirm Existence and Permissions of System Log Files
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: File permissions for all syslog log files should be set correctly.

ns0:extend_definition.comment: rsyslog daemon is used as local logging daemon

ns0:criterion.comment: Check permissions of all system log files

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify /boot/^System\.map.*$ Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /boot/^System\.map.*$ is owned by 0, group owned by 0, and has mode 0600. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify /etc/group Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /etc/group is owned by 0, group owned by 0, and has mode 0644. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify /etc/gshadow Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /etc/gshadow is owned by 0, group owned by 42, and has mode 0640. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify /etc/passwd Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /etc/passwd is owned by 0, group owned by 0, and has mode 0644. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify /etc/shadow Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /etc/shadow is owned by 0, group owned by 42, and has mode 0640. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to /home
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: /home should be mounted with mount option nodev.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nosuid Option to /home
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: /home should be mounted with mount option nosuid.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to /tmp
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: /tmp should be mounted with mount option nodev.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nosuid Option to /tmp
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: /tmp should be mounted with mount option nosuid.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to /usr
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: /usr should be mounted with mount option nodev.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: /var/lib should be mounted with mount option nodev.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nosuid Option to /var/lib
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: /var/lib should be mounted with mount option nosuid.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to /var/log
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: /var/log should be mounted with mount option nodev.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add noexec Option to /var/log
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: /var/log should be mounted with mount option noexec.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nosuid Option to /var/log
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: /var/log should be mounted with mount option nosuid.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to /var
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: /var should be mounted with mount option nodev.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add noexec Option to /var
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: /var should be mounted with mount option noexec.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nosuid Option to /var
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: /var should be mounted with mount option nosuid.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The DPKG package auditd should be installed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package cron Installed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The DPKG package cron should be installed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The DPKG package telnetd-ssl should be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The DPKG package telnetd should be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure /home Located On Separate Partition
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: If stored locally, create a separate partition for /home. If /home will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure /srv Located On Separate Partition
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: If stored locally, create a separate partition for /srv. If /srv will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure /tmp Located On Separate Partition
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: If stored locally, create a separate partition for /tmp. If /tmp will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure /var Located On Separate Partition
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: If stored locally, create a separate partition for /var. If /var will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure /var/log Located On Separate Partition
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: If stored locally, create a separate partition for /var/log. If /var/log will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure /var/log/audit Located On Separate Partition
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: If stored locally, create a separate partition for /var/log/audit. If /var/log/audit will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Service auditd Enabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The auditd service should be enabled if possible.

ns0:criteria.comment: package auditd installed and service auditd is configured to start
service auditd is configured to start and is running
service auditd is configured to start

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Service cron Enabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The cron service should be enabled if possible.

ns0:criteria.comment: package cron installed and service cron is configured to start
service cron is configured to start and is running
service cron is configured to start

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Service ntpd Enabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The ntpd service should be enabled if possible.

ns0:criteria.comment: package ntp installed and service ntpd is configured to start
service ntpd is configured to start and is running
service ntpd is configured to start

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Service rsyslog Enabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The rsyslog service should be enabled if possible.

ns0:criteria.comment: package rsyslog installed and service rsyslog is configured to start
service rsyslog is configured to start and is running
service rsyslog is configured to start

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Service sshd Disabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The sshd service should be disabled if possible.

ns0:criteria.comment: package openssh-server removed or service sshd is not configured to start
service sshd is not configured to start

ns0:criterion.comment: sshd socket not wanted by multi-user.target

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set All Accounts To Have Unique Names
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All accounts on the system should have unique names for proper accountability.

ns0:criteria.comment: There should not exist duplicate user name entries in /etc/passwd

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The maximum password age policy should meet minimum requirements.

ns0:criteria.comment: The value PASS_MAX_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The minimum password age policy should be set appropriately.

ns0:criteria.comment: The value of PASS_MIN_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: UID 0 Belongs Only To Root
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Only the root account should be assigned a user id of 0.

ns0:criterion.comment: tests that there are no accounts with UID 0 except root in the /etc/passwd file

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: All Password Hashes Shadowed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All password hashes should be shadowed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password minimum length should be set appropriately.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password expiration warning age should be set appropriately.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Lock out account after failed login attempts
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The number of allowed failed logins should be set correctly.

ns0:criteria.comment: Checks common to both scenarios

ns0:criterion.comment: pam_faillock.so preauth silent set in system-auth
pam_faillock.so set in account phase of system-auth
pam_faillock.so preauth silent set in password-auth
pam_faillock.so set in account phase of password-auth
Perform check if pam_faillock authfail follows pam_unix even with lines skipped
Perform check if pam_faillock authfail follows pam_unix with either sufficient or default=ignore
Perform check if pam_faillock authfail follows pam_unix even with lines skipped
pam_faillock.so authfail deny value set in password-auth

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Write permissions are disabled for group and other in all directories in Root's Path
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check each directory in root's path and make use it does not grant write permission to group and other

ns0:criteria.comment: Check that write permission to group and other in root's path is denied

ns0:criterion.comment: Check for write permission to group and other in root's path

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Check that no unauthenticated repository is authorized by configuration
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Accessing a repository should be allowed only when the repository is authenticated.

ns0:criteria.comment: Detect any usage of allow-ynauthenticated option

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: The syslog Plugin Of the Audit Event Multiplexor (audispd) Is Activated
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: active setting in /etc/audisp/plugins.d/syslog.conf is set to 'yes'

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: 'log_group' Not Set To 'root' In /etc/audit/auditd.conf
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Verify 'log_group' is not set to 'root' in /etc/audit/auditd.conf.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk Errors
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: disk_error_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk Is Full
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: disk_full_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Email Account to Notify Upon Action
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: action_mail_acct setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain account

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk is Low on Space
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: admin_space_left_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Maximum Log File Size
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: max_log_file setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to at least a certain value

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Action to Take When Maximum Log Size Reached
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: max_log_file_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Maximum Number of Logs to Retain
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: num_logs setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to at least a certain value

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Configure auditd space_left on Low Disk Space
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: space_left setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to at least a certain value

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk Starting to Run Low on Space
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: space_left_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure Yum gpgcheck Globally Activated
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The gpgcheck option should be used to ensure that checking of an RPM package's signature always occurs prior to its installation.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure the logrotate utility performs the automatic rotation of log files on daily basis
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The frequency of automatic log files rotation performed by the logrotate utility should be configured to run daily

ns0:criteria.comment: /etc/logrotate.conf contains daily setting and /etc/cron.daily/logrotate file exists

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if daily is set in /etc/logrotate.conf
Check if /etc/cron.daily/logrotate file exists (and calls logrotate)

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify /var/log/audit Ownership
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks that all /var/log/audit files and directories are owned by the root user and group.

ns0:criteria.comment: directories are root owned
log_group in auditd.conf is not root

ns0:extend_definition.comment: log_group in auditd.conf is not root

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Proper Permissions User Home Directories
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: File permissions should be set correctly for the home directories for all user accounts.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package Antivirus Installed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Antivirus software should be installed.

ns0:criteria.comment: Antivirus is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package McAfeeVSEForLinux Installed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: McAfee Antivirus software should be installed.

ns0:criteria.comment: Antivirus is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install the McAfee Runtime Libraries and Linux Agent
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Install the McAfee Runtime Libraries (MFErt) and Linux Agent (MFEcma).

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install McAfee Host-Based Intrusion Detection Software (HBSS)
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: McAfee Host-Based Intrusion Detection Software (HBSS) software should be installed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install the Asset Configuration Compliance Module (ACCM)
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Install the Asset Configuration Compliance Module (ACCM).

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install the Host Intrusion Prevention System (HIPS) Module
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Install the McAfee Host Intrusion Prevention System (HIPS) Module if it is absolutely necessary. If SELinux is enabled, do not install or enable this module.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install the Policy Auditor (PA) Module
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Install the Policy Auditor (PA) Module.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Check if the scan target is a container
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check if file /.dockerenv exists, if it does then we consider to be a docker filesystem.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Check if the scan target is a machine
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check if file /.dockerenv exists, if it doesn't then we consider to be host filesystem or virtual machine.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to Non-Root Local Partitions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nodev mount option prevents files from being interpreted as character or block devices. Legitimate character and block devices should exist in the /dev directory on the root partition or within chroot jails built for system services. All other locations should not allow character and block devices.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Require Client SMB Packet Signing, if using mount.cifs
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Require packet signing of clients who mount Samba shares using the mount.cifs program (e.g., those who specify shares in /etc/fstab). To do so, ensure that signing options (either sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i) are used.

ns0:criterion.comment: check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/fstab
check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/mtab

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Bind Mount /var/tmp To /tmp
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The /var/tmp directory should be bind mounted to /tmp in order to consolidate temporary storage into one location protected by the same techniques as /tmp.

ns0:criterion.comment: Ensure /var/tmp and /tmp have the same source device

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Direct root Logins Not Allowed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Preventing direct root logins help ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: No nullok Option in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The file /etc/pam.d/system-auth should not contain the nullok option

ns0:criterion.comment: make sure the nullok option is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure insecure_locks is disabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Allowing insecure file locking could allow for sensitive data to be viewed or edited by an unauthorized user.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check for insecure NFS locks in /etc/exports

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify No netrc Files Exist
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The .netrc files contain login information used to auto-login into FTP servers and reside in the user's home directory. Any .netrc files should be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: System Accounts Do Not Run a Shell
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The root account is the only system account that should have a login shell.

ns0:criterion.comment: Test shell defined for UID from <0, UID_MIN -1>
Test shell defined for reserved system UIDs
Test shell defined for dynamically allocated system UIDs

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package net-snmp Removed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package net-snmp should be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package prelink Removed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package prelink should be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Restrict Serial Port Root Logins
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Preventing direct root login to serial port interfaces helps ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Confirm Existence and Permissions of System Log Files
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All syslog log files should be owned by the appropriate user.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if all system log files are owned by root user

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Send Logs to a Remote Loghost
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Syslog logs should be sent to a remote loghost

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Restrict Virtual Console Root Logins
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Preventing direct root login to virtual console devices helps ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: SNMP default communities disabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SNMP default communities must be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: SNMP use newer protocols
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SNMP version 1 and 2c must not be enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure Only Protocol 2 Connections Allowed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The OpenSSH daemon should be running protocol 2.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is configured correctly or is not installed
sshd is not installed

ns0:extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required or requirement is unset

ns0:criteria.comment: sshd is installed and configured

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH version is equal or higher than 7.4 or it is configured with protocol 2

ns0:extend_definition.comment: OpenSSH version 7.4 or higher supports only protocol 2

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Empty Passwords
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Remote connections from accounts with empty passwords should be disabled (and dependencies are met)

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable SSH Support for Rhosts RSA Authentication
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SSH can allow authentication through the obsolete rsh command through the use of the authenticating user's SSH keys. This should be disabled.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is configured correctly or is not installed
sshd is not installed

ns0:extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required or requirement is unset

ns0:criteria.comment: sshd is installed and configured

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable root Login via SSH
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Root login via SSH should be disabled (and dependencies are met)

sshd is not installed

ns0:extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required or requirement is unset

ns0:criteria.comment: sshd is installed and configured

ns0:extend_definition.comment: sshd is required or requirement is unset

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable SSH Support for User Known Hosts
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SSH can allow system users host-based authentication to connect to systems if a cache of the remote systems public keys are available. This should be disabled.

sshd is not installed

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Enable X11Forwarding to encrypt X11 remote connections over SSH.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: If SSHD is not required, we check it is not installed. If SSH requirement is unset, we are good.

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: check for iommu=force in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX
check for fips=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT

ns4:file_test.comment: System log files are owned by root group
Permissions of system log files are 0640

ns5:systemdunitproperty_test.comment: Test that the auditd service is running
Test that the cron service is running
Test that the ntpd service is running
Test that the rsyslog service is running
Test that the sshd service is not running

ns4:sysctl_test.comment: kernel runtime parameter fs.protected_hardlinks set to 1
kernel runtime parameter fs.protected_symlinks set to 1
kernel runtime parameter fs.suid_dumpable set to 0
kernel runtime parameter kernel.dmesg_restrict set to 1
kernel runtime parameter kernel.kptr_restrict set to 1
kernel runtime parameter kernel.perf_cpu_time_max_percent set to 1
kernel runtime parameter kernel.perf_event_max_sample_rate set to 1
kernel runtime parameter kernel.perf_event_paranoid set to 2
kernel runtime parameter kernel.pid_max set to 65536
kernel runtime parameter kernel.randomize_va_space set to 2
kernel runtime parameter kernel.sysrq set to 0
kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.ip_forward set to the appropriate value
kernel runtime parameter vm.mmap_min_addr set to 65536

ns3:variable_test.comment: There should not exist duplicate user name entries in /etc/passwd
The value of PASS_MAX_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs
The value of PASS_MIN_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: test that there are no accounts with UID 0 except root in the /etc/passwd file

ns3:variable_test.comment: The value of PASS_MIN_LEN should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs
The value of PASS_WARN_AGE should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Checks if pam_faillock authfail is hit even if pam_unix skips lines by defaulting, and also authfail deny value
Checks if pam_faillock authfail is hit even if pam_unix skips lines by defaulting, and also authfail deny value
Check pam_faillock.so preauth silent present, with correct deny value, and is followed by pam_unix.
Check control values of pam_unix, that it is followed by pam_faillock.so authfail and deny value of pam_faillock.so authfail
Check if pam_faillock.so is called in account phase before pam_unix
Check pam_faillock.so preauth silent present in /etc/pam.d/password-auth, has correct deny value, and is followed by pam_unix
Check pam_faillock authfail is present after pam_unix, check pam_unix has proper control values, and authfail deny value is correct.
Check if pam_faillock_so is called in account phase before pam_unix.

ns4:file_test.comment: Check if there aren't directories in root's path having write permission set for group or other

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Checks usage of unauthenticated in apt.conf
Checks usage of unauthenticated in apt.conf.d/*
Tests the presence of daily setting in /etc/logrotate.conf file
Tests the existence of /etc/cron.daily/logrotate file (and verify it actually calls logrotate utility)
CPE vendor is 'fedoraproject' and 'product' is fedora

ns3:family_test.comment: installed OS part of unix family
Test installed OS is part of the unix family
installed OS part of unix family
installed OS part of unix family
installed OS part of unix family
installed OS part of unix family

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/fstab
check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/mtab
Ensure bind mount option is on /var/tmp

ns5:partition_test.comment: Ensure /var/tmp and /tmp have the same source device

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
Tests the value of the insecure locks in /etc/exports

ns3:variable_test.comment: <0, UID_MIN - 1> system UIDs having shell set
<0, SYS_UID_MIN> system UIDs having shell set
<SYS_UID_MIN, SYS_UID_MAX> system UIDS having shell set

ns4:file_test.comment: System log files are owned by root

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensures system configured to export logs to remote host
Ensures system configured to export logs to remote host
Tests the value of the PermitEmptyPasswords[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
Tests the value of the RhostsRSAAuthentication[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
Tests the value of the PermitRootLogin[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
Tests the value of the IgnoreUserKnownHosts[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
tests the value of X11Forwarding setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file

ns3:variable_test.comment: Verify if Profile set Value sshd_required as not required
Verify if Profile set Value sshd_required as required
Verify if Value of sshd_required is the default

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Tests the value of the ClientAliveCountMax setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
tests the value of Ciphers setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
tests the value of MACs setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file

ns5:systemdunitproperty_object.comment: Retrieve the ActiveState property of auditd
Retrieve the ActiveState property of cron
Retrieve the ActiveState property of ntpd
Retrieve the ActiveState property of rsyslog
Retrieve the ActiveState property of sshd

ns3:textfilecontent54_object.comment: Get number of lines pam_unix defaults to
Get number of lines pam_unix defaults to

ns4:file_object.comment: root's path directories with wrong group / other write permissions

ns3:textfilecontent54_object.comment: look for the partition mount point in /etc/mtab

ns5:systemdunitdependency_state.comment: auditd listed at least once in the dependencies
auditd listed at least once in the dependencies
